ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometer

Class Odometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometer.OdometerData
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.odometer.Odometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Odometer
extends OdometerData
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class implements odometry on our robot.
    Author:
    Caspar Cedro, Percy Chen, Patrick Erath, Anssam Ghezala, Susan Matuszewski, Kamy Moussavi Kafi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Odometer getOdometer()
      This class is meant to return the existing Odometer Object.
      static Odometer getOdometer(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor, EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor, double TRACK, double WHEEL_RAD)
      This method is meant to ensure only one instance of the odometer is used throughout the code.
      void run()
      This method is called when our Odometer object is started as a thread and begins to keep track of motor rotations

    • Method Detail

      • getOdometer

        public static Odometer getOdometer(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                                   EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                                   double TRACK,
                                   double WHEEL_RAD)
                            throws OdometerExceptions
        This method is meant to ensure only one instance of the odometer is used throughout the code.
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - The EV3LargeRegulatedMotor instance for our left motor
        rightMotor - The EV3LargeRegulatedMotor instance for our right motor
        Returns:
        new or existing Odometer Object
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • getOdometer

        public static Odometer getOdometer()
                            throws OdometerExceptions
        This class is meant to return the existing Odometer Object. It is meant to be used only if an odometer object has been created
        Returns:
        error if no previous odometer exists
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is called when our Odometer object is started as a thread and begins to keep track of motor rotations
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
